text: Comprehensive FAQs on mutual fund investing and investor service processes. Covers redemption in demat, KYC/KRA updates, statement downloads, payment modes, and operational policies. Note: MF investments are subject to market risks; read all scheme related documents carefully.

Once units are converted to Demat, redemption requests must be submitted via the DP or stock exchange platform in their prescribed format. Switch transactions are not possible for units held in Demat form.

Educational FAQs on mutual funds including SIP, STP, SWP, asset classes, and basic investor education topics. Links to calculators and investor education content (SIPAHI, Constitution of Investing, etc.).
AMFI investor education portal with guides on mutual fund basics, risk, KYC, and rights. Contains links to category definitions and standardized disclosures.
ELSS funds have a statutory lock-in of 3 years from the date of each investment. Redemptions are permitted after the completion of the lock-in for each installment.
SEBI investor education hub covering safe investing practices, complaint redressal, and regulatory awareness. Emphasizes that no investment advice should be taken from unverified channels.
Investors can download Consolidated Account Statement and capital gains statements using PAN+email or folio. Do not share OTPs. Statements cover transactions across RTAs where applicable.
Statement download portal for folio-level and PAN-linked statements including capital gains and account statements. Ensure correct email/mobile for OTP verification.
Scheme factsheet page includes latest expense ratio, benchmark, riskometer, portfolio and fund details. Values change periodically; always refer to the newest disclosure on this page.
KIM contains key terms including minimum investment/SIP amounts, options, loads, and plan details. Always consult the latest KIM for current thresholds and loads.
SID provides comprehensive scheme terms including exit load slabs, risk factors, benchmarking, asset allocation, and operational details. This is the authoritative reference for scheme terms.
